page.title: 14 The Baptist Church
page.content: The Baptist Church in Monmouth was formed in 1906.On 25th October,1906 the first three people in Monmouth were baptised in the River Wye. The chapel and its original school rooms still remain.The Pastor and 6 other people make up the Deaconship.The seven Deacons run the church and they are elected every 5 years by the members.As well as the normal Sunday services,there are a Sunday school, Sisterhood and a young people's meeting When entering the chapel on a Sunday, a stranger may be surprised that the Pastor is not wearing 'dog-collar'. Baptist ministers do not have to wear them. The church has a very relaxed and homely atmosphere.Young people can make many friends through their attendance at the church.
